definition: Arroganz refers to an attitude or behavior characterized by an excessive sense of superiority, self-importance, or entitlement. It is often used to describe someone who displays a haughty or condescending demeanor, looking down upon others and belittling them. This term is commonly employed to criticize individuals who exhibit an inflated ego or an overbearing sense of entitlement in various social contexts.

examples.german: Sie zeigte eine große Portion Arroganz.
examples.english: She displayed a great deal of arrogance.

examples.german: Die Arroganz des Chefs ist allgemein bekannt.
Er versteckt seine Unsicherheit hinter Arroganz.
examples.english: He hides his insecurity behind arrogance.

examples.german: Die Arroganz der Reichen und Mächtigen ist erschreckend.
examples.english: The arrogance of the rich and powerful is alarming.
